captions.text:
- YOU'RE, LIKE,
THIS ACTION STAR NOW.

- IMPROBABLE, NO?
[chuckles]
- WELL, NO, I DON'T--

WELL, YES.
- YEAH.

- I MEAN--
- I KNOW. I KNOW.

THEY DID AN ACTION FIGURE
FOR ME,

AND I LOOKED AT IT,
AND I THOUGHT,

"THERE CANNOT BE ANOTHER
50-YEAR-OLD MAN IN THE WORLD
WHO JUST GOT AN ACTION FIGURE."

WHO LOOKS LIKE ME, ANYWAY.
- YEAH.

- I MEAN, MAYBE HUGH JACKMAN
WOULD ARGUE, BUT--

- THAT'S THE ACTION FIGURE
RIGHT THERE.
- WOW.
- THAT'S VERY IMPRESSIVE.
- THEY DID ME SOME FAVORS.
- YEAH.
[cheers and applause]
- THANK YOU.

- YOU ALSO HAVE A BOBBLEHEAD,
WHICH--
- THE BOBBLEHEAD'S NEW.

THIS ONE'S A LITTLE MORE
LIFELIKE, I THINK.
[laughter]

- I MEAN, THAT'S--
YOU HAVE AN ACTION FIGURE
AND A BOBBLEHEAD.
- YEAH, I DO.

- I DON'T THINK I HAVE
EITHER OF THOSE THINGS.

- EVERYONE SHOULD HAVE
A BOBBLEHEAD.
- AND HOW OLD IS YOUR DAUGHTER?

- SO DOES SHE UNDERSTAND
HOW COOL HER DAD IS
THAT YOU HAVE THESE THINGS?
- SHE HAS HER DOUBTS.
[laughter]

SHE DIDN'T REALLY KIND OF THINK
ANY OF THIS WAS TOO COOL.
THE BOYS IN HER CLASS DID.

BUT THEN SHE WENT TO
THE PREMIERE OF, I THINK,

"THE AVENGERS" WITH ME
AND SAW CHRIS HEMSWORTH
AND TOM HIDDLESTON.

AND NOW SHE LIKES
THOSE MOVIES.
- YES, I BET.

DOES THAT MAKE YOU NERVOUS,
THAT SHE LIKES THOSE MOVIES
AND THOSE BOYS ARE AROUND?

- IT DOES, ELLEN. YES.
- UH-HUH.
- VERY MUCH SO, YES.
SHE GOES TO AN ALL-GIRLS SCHOOL.
AND THAT WAS HER CHOICE.

SHE LOVES IT.
IT'S A GREAT SCHOOL.

AND RECENTLY SHE WENT TO A PARTY
WITH SOME PEOPLE

FROM HER ELEMENTARY SCHOOL,
NOW THAT SHE'S IN MIDDLE SCHOOL.
AND BOYS WERE THERE.
AND SHE CAME BACK AND SAID,

"I THINK I'M GETTING THIRSTY
FOR BOYS."
[laughter]

SO THAT'S--THAT'S A THIRST
WE'RE GONNA ENCOURAGE HER
NOT TO QUENCH FOR A WHILE.
- WOW.
THAT'S HILARIOUS.

IS THAT A STATEMENT
ANYONE ELSE HAS HEARD?
IS THAT SOMETHING PEOPLE SAY?
"A THIRST FOR BOYS"?

- NO, I THINK SHE MIGHT HAVE
INVENTED THAT.

- WOW.
- UNFORTUNATELY.

- THAT'S--
SHE'S VERY--
- I HOPE IT DOESN'T GET OUT...

- YEAH.
- THAT SHE SAID THAT.

- SHE'S VERY--
NOBODY WILL--

IT'S JUST US IN HERE.
THAT'S OKAY.
- I'M IN BIG TROUBLE NOW.

- I WANT TO TALK ABOUT
YOUR DOGS,
BECAUSE I'M A HUGE ANIMAL LOVER,

AND I HEAR YOU HAVE
A VERY FUNNY STORY ABOUT--
YOU HAVE TWO DOGS?

- WE DO.
WE DO.

OUR INITIAL DOG,
THE DOG WE'VE HAD THE LONGEST,
IS A WONDERFUL--
[audience aws]
OH.
THEY'RE ACTUALLY THE--

THEY'RE THE NICEST PEOPLE
WHO LIVE IN THAT HOUSE--
IN OUR HOUSE.

- WHICH IS THE ONE YOU HAD
THE LONGEST?
- THE LARGEST, DOROTHY--

STELLA NAMED HER WHEN SHE WAS
IN A "WIZARD OF OZ" PHASE.

DOROTHY, THE LARGER BLONDE DOG
ON THE LEFT,
IS A LABRADOODLE.
SO IT'S AS SWEET AS A LABRADOR

AND AS SMART AS
THE SMARTEST POODLE.
AND SHE WAS VERY HAPPY.

AND THEN WE INHERITED THIS DOG,
AND DOROTHY,

WHO'D BEEN AN ONLY CHILD
FOR QUITE SOME TIME,

SHE WAS MISERABLE
AT SHARING OUR HOUSE.
AND SO I HAD NO CHOICE.

WE HAD TO TRY TO GIVE BIBI
TO SOMEBODY ELSE.

AND I LENT BIBI--OR GAVE BIBI
TO A WOMAN I KNOW.

AND MY DAUGHTER FINALLY REALIZED
THAT THE LITTLE DOG WAS GONE,
AND SAID, "PLEASE, PLEASE,

I NEED TO DO A SLEEPOVER
AND SAY GOOD-BYE."
AND WHEN WE BROUGHT BIBI BACK--

AND I'VE NEVER SEEN A DOG
DO THIS.

THE LITTLE DOG WALKED IN
THE HOUSE,

AND THE LABRADOODLE
LITERALLY WENT,
"OH, THANK GOD, SHE'S BACK.

"I FEEL LIKE--I THOUGHT
I MADE THE WORST MISTAKE.
I'M SO HAPPY YOU'RE HERE."

AND SINCE THEN,
IT'S BEEN ALL HARMONY.
[audience aws]
SO NOW THEY'RE BACK.

WASN'T A FUN PHONE CALL
TO THE PERSON

WHO I HAD TOLD
COULD HAVE THE DOG.

- YEAH, RIGHT, RIGHT.
"NEVER MIND."
WELL, THANKS FOR BEING HERE.

THANKS FOR SHARING
YOUR NEW BOBBLEHEAD WITH US.
AND GET YOURSELF A BIKE.

- I WILL. THANK YOU.
- DO IT.

MARVEL'S
"AGENTS OF S.H.I.E.L.D."

AIRS TUESDAYS AT 8:00
ON ABC.
WE'LL BE RIGHT BACK.
